dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reileen looks to Quell, accusing, angry --

dialogues.speaker: REILEEN
dialogues.text: So the rise of the Protectorate is your fault?

dialogues.speaker: QUELL
dialogues.text: I thought I was giving humanity a way to travel instantly between the stars,

dialogues.speaker: REILEEN
dialogues.text: Instead you were building the roads for the Roman Empire. Why the fuck should we listen to a word you say? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 11 12 ALTErED CArBON - 101 INTERIM DRAFT 7-8-16 16.

dialogues.speaker: 0.G. KOVACS
dialogues.text: (hand on her arm) Rei --

dialogues.speaker: QUELL
dialogues.text: No, she's right. What's your name, Recruit?

dialogues.speaker: REILEEN
dialogues.text: Reileen Kawahara. This is my brother, Takeshi Kovacs.

dialogues.speaker: 0.G. KOVACS
dialogues.text: We're from Harlan's World. What's left of it. Quell looks over the Recruits.

dialogues.speaker: QUELL
dialogues.text: We were the transitional generation. The first to have stacks. The Protectorate promised us immortality, but delivered total control, ruthless and merciless. And worse is coming. (answering Reileen's question) You should listen to me because I can teach you how to fight back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she speaks, Kovacs tenses, sensing without looking -- FOUR HUGE ORDERLIES have come up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: ORIENTATION WOMAN
dialogues.text: A sleeve is replaceable -- but if your stack is destroyed, you die. There's no coming back from Real Death. An OFFICIOUS SUITED MAN joins the Orderlies. Silhouetted the darkened room.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: I'm Director Sullivan. I don't want to know your name. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: (re: Orientation Woman) Shh, she's just getting to the good part. The Director nods to the Orderlies, who step up around Ko (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 12 13 ALTErED CArBON - 101 INTERIM DRAFT 7-8-16 17.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Now. Kovacs looks at the hulking Orderlies -- shrugs, gets up go with the Director. As they exit the darkened room --

dialogues.speaker: ORIENTATION WOMAN
dialogues.text: (chirpily, smiling) So avoid blunt force trauma to the base of the brain, or energy weapons fired at your head. We recommend you don't drive heavy machinery or make any life-altering decisions in the next few days. Congratulations on the new you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Director Sullivan walks with Kovacs through the corridors past repurposed cell blocks, the barred doors hanging ope unused. The Director opens a holoscreen in front of them as they continue to walk.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: This is your parole document. Certifying that your DHF has been sleeved in a body equipped with military-grade neurachem, combat muscle memory, and fitted with an ONI.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: ONI? That sounds like sushi.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Ocular Neural Interface. He hands Kovacs a wristband with a thin, matte black rectangle, a single blue dot glowing in the middle.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR SULLIVAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here's the remote hub. Thumbprint- keyed. Curious, Kovacs slips the wristband on, thumbs the blue d and one of his eyes REFLECTS, a glimmering circle around edge of the retina. POV KOVACS as he sees a range of options around the edges his vision -- like a smartphone directly in his eye. The hub glows with a simple, elegant interface. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALTErED CArBON - 101 INTERIM DRAFT 7-8-16 18.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: Contact lens HUD. Fancy.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Those were the specs we were given by your lease-holder. Bancroft Industries.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: You have questions, ask Bancroft. You're his problem now, not mine. But if you don't do what he wants? You come right back here for the rest of your sentence. POV KOVACS as they pass SHACKLED PRISONERS being led past He meets the eyes of a PRISONER leaning against the wall smoking a cigarette as a Guard waits impatiently.

dialogues.speaker: MALE PRISONER
dialogues.text: (to Kovacs, shrugs) Gotta put it in neutral, brother Let it coast. (takes a deep drag) Not like I'm gonna use these lungs again. So who cares, yeah? Kovacs looks back to the Director.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: Real humane.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: You commit a crime, you go into storage and your body belongs to the state to do what we want with. That's how it is.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: What about rights?

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Someone like you? You don't have any. They walk past ANOTHER PRISONER, sobbing and thrashing as he's dragged down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: Good to know. They reach a pair of opaque glass sliding doors. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 13 14 15 ALTErED CArBON - 101 INTERIM DRAFT 7-8-16 19.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Bancroft's sent someone to pick you up in the Re-Meet hall. But I'll see you again soon.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: I'm touched by your faith in me.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: I read your file. Felony stack theft organic damage, murder -- and that's the part that wasn't redacted. You're a recidivist. You'll be back, and you'll be locked up for good, where you belong. I may not know your name. But I know people like you.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: There aren't any other people like me. Not anymore. The doors slide open, and Kovacs strides out, leaving the Orderlies and the baffled Director behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kovacs emerges into A VAST OUTER HALL that forms the exit the building -- THE RE-MEET HALL. At the opposite end of the hall, automa doors slide open to reveal a bright day outside -- Kovacs glimpses a noisy DEMONSTRATION, SHOUTING and SIGN-WAVING visible for an instant before the doors slide closed agai Kovacs glances around -- BENCHES scattered, PEOPLE sittin or milling. Their eyes on the doors from the clinic. Nervous. A trickle of NEWLY-SLEEVED PEOPLE emerge, blinking in the light, stunned, disoriented.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOUNG TAKESHI KOVACS (12) and his older sister REILEEN (1 stand in a crowded Re-Meet hall, older tech but still recognizable. Young Takeshi's eyes dart back and forth as he searches the crowd EMERGING from the clinic.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG TAKESHI
dialogues.text: Do you see Dad yet?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG REILEEN
dialogues.text: Not yet. But he'll be here. Off Young Takeshi, eyes searching --  16 ALTErED CArBON - 101 INTERIM DRAFT 7-8-16 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OLDER JUNKIE WOMAN approaches a FAMILY. They crane pas her, looking at the doors, until she greets the FATHER --

dialogues.speaker: OLD JUNKIE WOMAN
dialogues.text: Daddy...? (off his blank look) It's me.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Cindy? She starts crying as the Family looks at her in disbelief verging on horror. The Father grabs a passing SECURITY GU

dialogues.speaker: FATHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Our girl was murdered in a hit-and- run! Law says she gets a free sleeve -- (indicates the Junkie) Cindy is seven years old!

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: (tired, he does this a lot) This is what we had in inventory. You don't like it, you can pay for an upgrade or put her back in storage. Kovacs passes by, not staring, but listening, absorbing, he goes by -- THE JUNKIE WOMAN clings to the Mother, skinny fingers clutching desperately.

dialogues.speaker: CINDY
dialogues.text: I don't want to go back into the dark, Mommy. BACK ON KOVACS, headed for the door -- as A WOMAN in MIRR GLASSES unfolds herself from a bench, lithe as a cat. She crosses to meet Kovacs. She's Latina, with a beautiful, unselfconscious strength about her Getting a good look at Kovacs, she stops short, something about her reaction to Kovacs seems off for an instant... nervous, surprised, something. But she quickly covers. Smiles, chatty.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: (extends her hand) Kristin Ortega. I'm taking you to the Bancroft residence. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 16 17 ALTErED CArBON - 101 INTERIM DRAFT 7-8-16 21.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They shake, she keeps pumping his hand, holding on maybe fraction longer than necessary.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Welcome to Bay City! You're going to love it here. Kovacs extricates his hand. Not loving the enthusiasm. As they start walking, Ortega chats animatedly --

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The car's right outside. You're good to go, right? Since if you had bags, you left them on another planet a few centuries ago.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: She drives and she's funny. Jackpot.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: You're not even sleeve-sick. I'm impressed. How long ago did they decant you?

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: Long enough.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: (as they move to the doors) Keep your head down, there's a little spirited public debate going on outside. But don't worry. I doa little security work on the side. I'll protect you.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: Good. I deplore violence. They exit through the doors --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Into the middle of a RAUCOUS DEMONSTRATION. Kovacs is swept into the crowd, an almost surreal immersion into ye and jostling bodies, people shoving pamphlets into his ha and SHOUTING into his face. TWO GROUPS OF PROTESTORS with holographic placards and pamphlets, SHOUTING at each other and anyone else who com near them. (Think the energy, fervor, and anger of pro-li and pro-choice demonstrators outside a clinic.) The ANTI-653 SIDE wear crosses, carry signs saying things like YOU CANNOT DIGITIZE THE SOUL. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 17 18 19 ALTErED CArBON - 101 INTERIM DRAFT 7-8-16 22.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The PRO-653 SIDE carry pamphlets with images of VICTIMS O CRIMES. As Kovacs and Ortega push their way through, we can make a little bit through the cacophony: "Stop Resolution 653! "You cannot store the soul in a stack!" "Yes on 653!" "Victims have the right to speak!" As he and Ortega clear the edge of the demonstration, one the Demonstrators gets up in Kovacs' face and YELLS --

dialogues.speaker: DEMONSTRATOR
dialogues.text: God is watching! And he will judge your sins!

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: That's gonna keep him busy a while. Ortega takes him to a LIMO that's hovering nearby. She hi the car alarm, it CHIRPS and the car settles to the groun doors opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wide on the city as the limo flies over Bay City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The windows are all opaqued, except for the front windshi which is showing mostly sky. Ortega drives, continuing to talk a mile a minute.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: Sorry about that. Neo-Catholics they're fucking lunatics, and 653 has them coming out of the woodwork -- Kovacs is glancing at one of the pamphlets, rows of HOLO- IMAGES of mostly YOUNG WOMEN. YES ON 653: Let The Dead Sp Is printed below their faces.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: What's 653?

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: It's a test case just went through U.N. court, something about spinning up murder victims in VR to testify who killed them. But the church says once your birth sleeve dies you're in the hands of God -- spin up your stack and your soul is damned. Kovacs is thumbing through the pamphlet -- ANGLE ON ROWS FACES, mostly young beautiful women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALTErED CArBON - 101 INTERIM DRAFT 7-8-16 23.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: [Note: We don't pay much attention now, but these faces w matter later.]

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: So these victims -- their stacks just stay on ice forever?

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: And whoever killed them walks away. Neo-C's have religious exemption coding on their stacks, makes it illegal to spin them back up -- 653 was supposed to change that, but the court threw it out. The Archdiocese is happy though -- they say it's better the murder go unsolved than the victim's soul go to hell. (glances at him in the mirror) What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: I think no one in the Archdiocese has ever been murdered. Violent death will do wonders for your perspective.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: Is that experience talking? I mean no offense, but whatever you did, it must have been pretty bad -- down for close to five hundred years, they said. What were you in for?

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: A little of this, a little of that. Blew some shit up, killed some people.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: Some people just need killing.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: Any particular way you decide who dies?

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: Depends on the day. Anything can set me off -- interstellar dictatorship, genocide, people who talk too much. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 19 20 21 ALTErED CArBON - 101 INTERIM DRAFT 7-8-16 24,

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ortega seems cheerfully undeterred by the jab. Or oblivio It's hard to tell.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: Making conversation's just part of the job. You work for Bancroft, you do what you're told. So what does he want with you?

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: No fucking clue. I don't even know who the man is.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: You have been under a while. Everybody knows Laurens Bancroft. He's one of the richest men in the Protectorate, powerful, influential -- he's a Meth, of course --

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: Meth. You know -- "Methuselahs." From the bible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limo moves through a cloud layer --

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: "And the days of Methuselah were nine hundred and sixty-nine years." -- And the limo emerges ABOVE the clouds, where gleaming spired buildings pierce the cloud layer and rise high abo it, like palaces built for new and unimaginable gods.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Laurens Bancroft is five hundred and thirty-two years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kovacs is craning out to see the skyline through the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: How can people live that long now? Back when I come from, resleeve too many times and you'd eventually go a little nuts. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 21 22 ALTErED CArBON - 101 INTERIM DRAFT 7-8-16 25.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: Not if you resleeve right back into your own body. Growing a single clone still costs more than most people make in a lifetime. A lot more. But the ultrawealthy -- and that's the Meths -- can afford multiple clones. They resleeve themselves, one lifetime after another.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: What about everybody else?

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: We scrape by. People get hurt or get old, they resleeve if they can in whatever they can afford, but like you say, can't do it too many times or... She makes a "kaboom" motion with her hand at her temple.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe that's why Meths like to live up here, they call it the Aerium. The rest of us seem pretty small to them. Our tiny, quick little lives. But if you were around that long ago, you must have been alive when stacks were invented.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: Yeah. You got any cigarettes?

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: You kidding? That shit will kill you.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: Not a big issue for me right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge, luxurious estate rising high above the clouds, th tallest by far of the many Meth super-high structures. A tasteful combo of manicured green lawns and gravel. The sprawling grounds go on for acres, cantilevered over the abyss of sky that seems to go on forever below.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: What was it like? Before stacks? Below the soaring, graceful architecture of Suntouch Hous CLOUDS drift like a moving landscape. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 22 23 ALTErED CArBON - 101 INTERIM DRAFT 7-8-16 26.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Simpler. THE LIMO banks down toward the estate, descending toward PUTTING GREEN near the house.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: So -- home planet, that kind of thing? Where were you born?

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: Not here.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: You want to know why Bancroft thawed you, I'm wondering the same thing. What does the man who literally has everything want with a popsicle from half a millennia ago?

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: You really do have a way with words.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: My abuela, she always said, Kristin you can find a way to talk to anybody.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: Especially if they're trapped ina car with you. Kovacs looks at the rapidly approaching ground -- there's edge to Ortega's voice as she wrestles with the controls

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: Listen, pendejo. I want to help you. I mean, you're a felon, Bancroft has you by the brainstem. Do what he wants or go back on ice. He owns you... but what the hell does he want?

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: Nobody owns me. Ortega lands the limo with a GRINDING THUMP, tearing up c of lush lawn as she brings the limo to a shuddering halt.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That was a terrible landing. But you're not just a driver, are you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 23 ALTErED CArBON - 101 INTERIM DRAFT 7-8-16 27.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: (countering) You're not just a criminal, Sunshine.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: This hasn't been a conversation. It's been an interrogation. You do a lot of undercover work? Cause you might want to consider another line of work. ANGLE THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD -- SECURITY GUARDS are rushi from the house, converging on the limo.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They don't look very glad to see you. Ortega's friendly facade drops. All business now.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: I said I worked security. I didn't say for who. Ortega opens the limo door -- slipping a POLICE BADGE out her pocket and onto her belt with one easy move.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Last chance. Just give me a name.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: Aren't you going to open my door?

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: Name, dickbrain. Kovacs opens his own car door

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: Takeshi Kovacs. Look me up. He gets out, leaving her behind. ON ORTEGA as she puts a finger to her temple, we see her eyes FLASH as she activates her ONI -- POV ORTEGA, seeing images flash by, looking up Kovacs jus the way we would use a smartphone now, racing through dat seeing still images of STRONGHOLD, of QUELL -- -- And finally, the word ENVOY.  24 ALTErED CArBON - 101 INTERIM DRAFT 7-8-16 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kovacs stands on the lawn, as Ortega comes scrambling aft him. Large chunks of grass have been gouged out of the immaculately groomed lawn by the cruiser.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: You're lying. You can't be who you say you are. All the Envoys died.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: All but one. Sunshine. SECURITY GUARDS converge around them --

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Stop where you are!

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: I'm Bay City PD and you know it, Curtis. So lower your weapons and tell me where your boss is because I would like a fucking word. A GORGEOUS BLONDE WOMAN, early 30's, comes striding throu the Guards. MIRIAM BANCROFT. She's dressed in athletic clothes that show off a figure toned to perfection, dewy with sweat.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Miriam, outraged) What have you people done? Miriam recognizes Ortega, and there's no love lost here.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Ortega. You're trespassing on private property -- (glances at the limo) -- And you apparently stole one of our limos. I could have you shot. A WHIRR OF ENGINES -- A POLICE CRUISER emerges from the c cover, framing Ortega from behind like a looming bird of prey --

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: You could certainly try. -- Before it touches down next to the Limo, ripping throu even more of the lawn.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: (aside, to Ortega) Nice timing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 24 ALTErED CArBON - 101 INTERIM DRAFT 7-8-16 29.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: (gritted teeth) Fuck you. (to Miriam) Do you know who this is? What he is?

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: He's the Envoy. But more importantly, he's none of your business. The Police Cruiser disgorges several plainclothes policem with MOHAWK HAIRCUTS (varying ages and ethnicities, among them BAUTISTA, a lifer who has Ortega's back).

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Kovacs) Why did you bring them here? Isaac was supposed to drive you --

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: As in your son, Isaac? Bautista pulls A YOUNG MAN, maybe 19, out of the cruiser He looks bleary and sick -- meet ISAAC BANCROFT.

dialogues.speaker: BAUTISTA
dialogues.text: We picked him up on a DUI. Miriam hurries to her son's side, he pulls away sullenly.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Isaac, what were you doing drinking?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I'm not a goddamned chauffeur

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Go inside. (to Ortega ) I'm going to report you, this is police harassment. The Mohawks are already getting back in the cruiser. Orte pauses at the door.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: (pointing) There's your kid, there's your car, and there's your new pet terrorist. You're welcome.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: The terrorist can hear you. Standing right here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 24 25 ALTErED CArBON - 101 INTERIM DRAFT 7-8-16 30.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: Good. Cause we're not finished, you and me. She slams the door shut. The cruiser lifts off. Miriam turns to Kovacs. Her attitude preemptory, arrogant. Very aware of the effect of her looks.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: What are you waiting for? Get inside --

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: I'm not great at following directions. Or taking orders. Or really anything that involves a chain of command. Miriam pulls back on the snark. She's not used to being talked back to. Maybe she likes it.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Of course. We're just all so tense, since... I'm Miriam Bancroft, we haven't been properly introduced. Please forgive me. They head inside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Where Miriam leads him past A CRUMBLING BLUE STONE TRE (a SONGSPIRE) twined like a living sculpture up the walls topmost branches veining the ceiling. At once majestic an incredibly fragile.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: Shouldn't that be in a museum? She turns and smiles at him. Sex and innocence at once.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Definitely. But I have a weakness for Elder Civilization artifacts. I collect them. Among other things.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: It must have cost a fortune to ship it here.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: A few fortunes. And several lifetimes as well. But cost was no object. Miriam gently trails her fingers down one of the tree's branches -- and it makes a musical sound, like delicate b of chiming glass. An alien, unimaginable sound. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 25 26 27 ALTErED CArBON - 101 INTERIM DRAFT 7-8-16 31.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ON KOVACS as we FLASH TO HIS MEMORY, the Songspire sound rising louder and louder, not one spire but THOUSANDS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MASSIVE ALIEN CITY -- ancient ruins, with SONGSPIRES tw over everything, incredibly complex and massive. SONGSPIR CHIMES ringing over the city in a rich natural melody. Light from 3 suns streams down over broken, crumbling spi and the sound of CHILDREN LAUGHING. PAN DOWN to see jury-rigged STRUCTURES built into the rui People working, living. A REBELLION BASE in hiding, inclu ENVOYS -- among them, 0.G. KOVACS and the RECRUITS we saw before. Body armor, ragtag equipment. Talking, working, playing with the kids and families who have sought refuge here.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM, (PRELAPPED)
dialogues.text: This is the only Songspire on Earth.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: No one is sure what they are, even if they're alive. They grow, but they could have functioned as part of Elder Civilization architecture, programmed to continue expanding. The largest ones recorded --

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: -- Are thousands of meters high, I know. I've seen them.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Stronghold. Of course. She locks eyes with his. Part test. Part seduction.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM, (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: 27 28 ALTErED CArBON - 101 INTERIM DRAFT 7-8-16 32.

dialogues.text: It's a strange thing, holding her book in your hand, isn't it? BANCROFT has entered the room: 50's, handsome, athletic, exuding power and confidence -- -- And without warning, Kovacs turns and SLAMS Bancroft u against the wall.

dialogues.text: ALTErED CArBON - 101 INTERIM DRAFT 7-8-16 33.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I fought a war to stop people like you from happening, and if someone doesn't tell me, right now, what the fuck all this is about, I might very well lose my temper. Bancroft isn't fazed. If anything, he's enjoying this a little -- there's respect in his face, not anger.

dialogues.speaker: BANCROFT, (CONT'D)

I've opened a line of credit in your name, DNA trace accessible, to cover all your expenses. dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: The Protectorate won't allow it. No one has that kind of power. Not even you.

dialogues.speaker: BANCROFT
dialogues.text: Power is a living thing, Mr. Kovacs. Tended properly, over time, it grows. And I have had a great deal of time. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 28 29 ALTErED CArBON - 101 INTERIM DRAFT 7-8-16 34.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: Say you can deliver -- what do you want from me?

dialogues.speaker: BANCROFT
dialogues.text: I need you to solve a murder.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: Whose?

dialogues.speaker: BANCROFT
dialogues.text: Mine. He looks at Kovacs. A beat, then --

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: As youve pointed out, Im not exactly from around here. What makes you think Id even know where to begin? Bancroft picks up the book that Kovacs was holding.

dialogues.speaker: BANCROFT
dialogues.text: Because you knew her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk through the vast vaulted space of the house.

dialogues.speaker: BANCROFT
dialogues.text: Quellcrist Falconer was a brilliant strategist. Only she could have created the Envoy Corps.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: Im surprised anyone still knows who we were. Bancroft turns the book over in his hands. BANCROFT (CONTD) You didnt fade from memory after Strongholds defeat, Mr. Kovacs. Your kind became legend.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: My kind no longer exists.

dialogues.speaker: BANCROFT
dialogues.text: But you do. Envoys were known, not just for their combat skills, but for their ability to find the truth to discover what is hidden. I have a mystery for you to solve. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 29 30 31 ALTErED CArBON - 101 INTERIM DRAFT 7-8-16 35.

dialogues.speaker: BANCROFT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The reward is your freedom, and the stakes are my life. Will you at least hear me out? Off Kovacs, considering --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kovacs follows Bancroft into a STUDY. A mirrorwood DESK gleams by the wall, a jagged SCORCH MARK above it.

dialogues.speaker: BANCROFT
dialogues.text: This is where Miriam found me. Head taken off with a particle blaster behind my desk. The weapon was mine, I keep it for protection stored ina biometric safe that only Miriam and myself can open. Kovacs looks at him. Says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: BANCROFT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go ahead and say it, everyone else has. Either I committed suicide or my wife murdered me.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: But you're here. Meaning your stack is intact, so you must remember what happened.

dialogues.speaker: BANCROFT
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) I'm afraid it was completely destroyed. RD'd, as they say. Thoughts?

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: Only one. Remote storage backup. I'd guess offsite, secure and secret. Bancroft goes to a circular staircase, Kovacs follows.

dialogues.speaker: BANCROFT
dialogues.text: Let me show you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come out onto a high crow's nest-like balcony. The view is PANORAMIC, over the whole estate and the ocean be (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALTErED CArBON - 101 INTERIM DRAFT 7-8-16 36.

dialogues.speaker: BANCROFT
dialogues.text: When I was younger, I used to come up here when I had decisions to make, or difficulties to face. I would think about the ancient explorers back when one could spend a lifetime pursuing the secrets of the Earth the ocean, the stars... There are RELICS OF EXPLORATION all around the room -- a SEXTANT, an ASTROLABE, hand-drawn MAPS of the Earth, more MAPS OF THE HEAVENS, along with TELESCOPE IMAGES of dista stars and galaxies, like paintings made of light. But the room has an unlived-in feel, a light coating of d covering everything.

dialogues.speaker: BANCROFT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I haven't been here in years. The age of adventurers and explorers is over. Bancroft stops in front of AN ANTIQUE BRASS TELESCOPE, bo on the railing. A digital keypad below it, wired to the telescope. Dust disturbed here, a few fingermarks. Bancroft keys in coordinates on the pad; as the motor att to the telescope WHIRS, repositioning its angle --

dialogues.speaker: BANCROFT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (as the telescope comes to a stop) Go ahead -- tell me what you see. Kovacs puts his eye to the viewfinder: sees AN ANGULAR ME OBJECT floating against the backdrop of the darkening sky

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: Protectorate satellite. Looks military grade.

dialogues.speaker: BANCROFT
dialogues.text: It is. But it's not the Protectorate's. It's mine. Every 48 hours my stack is automatically needlecast to it. Foolproof backup. (a beat) When Miriam found me, my last backup was already downloading into this cloned sleeve. Whoever wanted me dead must have had a plan for disabling the backup -- but it failed. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALTErED CArBON - 101 INTERIM DRAFT 7-8-16 37.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: So your... current self doesn't have any memory of what happened?

dialogues.speaker: BANCROFT
dialogues.text: The last thing I remember is being in my lawyer's office, going over trade deals in the Orion belt. Whoever killed me pulled the trigger 10 minutes before my backup went through --

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: Which means your memories of those 48 hours are gone.

dialogues.speaker: BANCROFT
dialogues.text: Lost completely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kovacs and Bancroft walk on the grounds of the estate.

dialogues.speaker: BANCROFT
dialogues.text: Someone wants me dead. Permanently. They will try again, and next time they might well succeed. Unless you find them first.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: For all I know, you did try to slag yourself and just botched the job. For the first time, we see the steel behind Bancroft's pleasant manner.

dialogues.speaker: BANCROFT
dialogues.text: Mr. Kovacs. I have lived through the Corporate Wars, the collapse and rebuilding of my industrial and trading interests, brought 48 children into the world and survived the real deaths of two of them. I am not the kind of man to take my own life, and even if I were, I would not have bungled it in this fashion. If I meant to die, I would be dead. Kovacs looks into Bancroft's eyes as he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: I've heard you out. But I don't want your money. Or your pardon. I'll take eternity on ice, thanks. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 32 33 34 ALTErED CArBON - 101 INTERIM DRAFT 7-8-16 38.

dialogues.speaker: BANCROFT
dialogues.text: May I ask why?

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: You know what regular people do when they get RD'd? Nothing, because they're dead. Your world, your problems. Doesn't have anything to do with me. Bancroft regards Kovacs. Thinking.

dialogues.speaker: BANCROFT
dialogues.text: Take a day, Mr. Kovacs. Go out into the world. Breathe air into your lungs, feel the wind on your skin. Remember what it is to be alive. As Kovacs turns to go --

dialogues.speaker: BANCROFT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And please. Take this. He hands him the Quellcrist book.

dialogues.speaker: BANCROFT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Like everything else I'm offering... it's yours. If you want it. Off Kovacs, looking down at the book in his hand --

dialogues.text: 38 ALTErED CArBON - 101 INTERIM DRAFT 7-8-16 42.

dialogues.text: The TWO GENE FREAK FIGHTERS come into focus, on a collisi course, with Kovacs in between -- one has fangs and claws and glowing red eyes, the other is massively muscled -- Kovacs' instincts overcome him, he drops into a combat cr his neurachem FLARES in a glow beneath his skin, differen and brighter than what we saw in the opening -- he swings

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Broadcast blocker. Peace offering. CLOSE ON THE BACK OF HIS NECK, as we see the tiny patch s put on him FADE and blend invisibly into his skin.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I'm hell on lampposts. (surveying the damage) Neurachem's been a little upgraded from my day.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: A lot of things have. You want to tell me what you're doing out here?

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: Being followed, apparently.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: That's what the police do to manipulative psychotic terrorists.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: You could stop calling me that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALTErED CArBON - 101 INTERIM DRAFT 7-8-16 43.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: You could tell me what Bancroft wants you for.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: You already know. You're overzealous judgmental, and unprofessional, but you're not stupid.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: I am not unprofessional.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: He wants me to solve his murder.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: You mean he wants you to investigate the non-criminal non-event of his suicide.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: Because you didn't. Or couldn't. Or won't. It was your case, wasn't it? And you fucked it up.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: You know what, just forget it -- She starts to go --

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: You want to start over? No problem. Seems like that's what I do now. Let's go for a drink. (holds out his hand) Takeshi Kovacs. Ortega shakes his hand, but this time pulls back quickly, if his touch burned her.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry. Forgot. You don't approve of the Uprising-era killing machine.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: You want to get a fucking drink or not?

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: As long as I get to pick the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move through a strip bar, music pulsing, dancers grinding Familiar but different -- the costumes are lit up, fibero (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 39 ALTErED CArBON - 101 INTERIM DRAFT 7-8-16 44.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: and LED and gleaming illuminum tattoos -- but the writhin pole-swinging dance is as old as time. Find Kovacs and Or at the bar, near the stage. A line of shot glasses in fro of them.

dialogues.text: You know who's cleared the most cases in the department for the last 5 years running? Me. I close a case, it stays closed, because I am fucking good at my job --

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: So the whole "just-keep-talking" thing wasn't an act.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: Fine, you talk. Tell me why Bancroft thinks you'll find something that Bay City PD couldn't.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: It's called Envoy Intuition. He motions for another round.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Total absorb of whatever's around you without prejudgement or preconception. You make observations draw conclusions from what appear to be disparate pieces of data. It's hard to explain how it works, it just sort of... comes together in my head. Voices, memories, moments of things I saw that didn't seem related... and then suddenly they are.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: Put it like that, it sounds like a bunch of lucky guesses.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: "Luck" isn't a word I associate with myself.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: Yeah. Takeshi Kovacs. Mercenary turned Envoy turned mercenary again, sole survivor of the Stronghold Slaughter. Known by quite a few names -- Mamba Lev, One Hand Rending, the Icepick. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALTErED CArBON - 101 INTERIM DRAFT 7-8-16 45.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: (almost wistful) I really liked that one.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: So that's what you are now? The man who doesn't give a damn about anything?

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: This drink tastes pretty good. Those tits over there look pretty nice.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: There's no case. You're wasting your time.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: You want to tell me what your problem is with Bancroft?

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: I'm not the one with the problem. He got me reprimanded when I couldn't find his "killer." Tried to screw with my career, which means with my life. And he's still doing it.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: You're saying you didn't deserve it?

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: (heated) I polygraphed the wife at her own insistence. She passed without a twitch. We chased down every lead, checked on his friends and his enemies, people with opportunity and motive, and we always came back to the same thing. He locked himself in his study and offed himself.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: And just conveniently forgot that he'd be resleeved in less than an hour?

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: I deal in facts, not Meth motivations. Who the hell knows why they do whatever crazy shit they do.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: Bancroft strikes me as a lot of things. Crazy isn't on the list. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALTErED CArBON - 101 INTERIM DRAFT 7-8-16 46.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: Let me tell you what went over my desk the night Bancroft bought it. Four stabbings, ten shootings -- three of which were RD's -- five drunk driving fatalities. One sleeve killing -- (heavy sarcasm) -- Oh, wait, not a sleeve kill, she was a Neo-Catholic strangled and dumped in the bay. As in, actually murdered.

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: (slams her hands on the table) Are you a moron, or just an asshole? There is no Bancroft case! A beat as some people look over --

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's what I do -- I spend my days and nights throwing people on ice after they tear each other apart, just so they can serve a few months get out and start over again. I'm on a fucking hamster wheel and I'm still, to reiterate, very motherfucking professional. I keep people alive, I catch bad guys. And that Meth fuckhead kicks me down the ladder for what? His wounded self- image?

dialogues.text: (calls to the waitress) 1 take the check. we

dialogues.text: I'm not finished with you, Kovacs.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS
dialogues.text: That's your call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the DANCERS crouches down to grind sinuously in fr of Kovacs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALTErED CArBON - 101 INTERIM DRAFT 7-8-16 47.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When a sleeve has been slabbed a long time, it just keeps on making hormones, did you know that?

dialogues.text: So that first time, when you're fresh out of the tank --

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: Kovacs. Shut the fuck up. (to the dancer) Get lost.

dialogues.text: Just thought, since you took me out for a drink --

dialogues.speaker: ORTEGA
dialogues.text: You're paying, and one more time: shut. Up.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Envoys weren't commandos, not exactly. We weren't terrorists, either. We were soldiers who turned our backs on immortality to try to save humanity from itself.

dialogues.text: Kovacs has his arm turned up, as the TATTOO ARTIST uses something like a tiny vibrating arc-welder to cut his fle but instead of black ink, he pours white-hot liquid "illuminum" into his skin. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: Learned techniques of honing pure mind that let us move between battlefield planets like ghosts, from one sleeve to another, digital guerrillas striking and then melting back into the electronic sleet The tattoo takes form like liquid opal in his skin, gem-b depth and sheen.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: So it should have been easy for me to die. I'd done it before. It sizzles against his skin, then cools instantly, taking form --

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But I'd seen her. Heard her voice, watched her move in the moonlight The Artist continues molding and shaping, carving the for of the tattoo -- the OUROBOROS.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: And real or imagined, if the one way I could be with her was to survive, then I was going to do it Kovacs types something into the hub strapped to his wrist The ONI in his eye GLEAMS, showing it's activated. He's talking with someone, we just can't see who.

dialogues.speaker: KOVACS, (CONT'D)
